alert.note: Alert for Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 11:38AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Keokuk, western Johnson, northern Washington and southern Iowa Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1138 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Parnell to near Kinross to near Martinsburg. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Williamsburg and Parnell around 1145 AM CDT. Wellman around 1150 AM CDT. Kalona and Oxford around 1155 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Washington, Coralville, North Liberty, Tiffin, University Heights, Hills, Richmond, Oakdale, Iowa City and Riverside. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 215 and 244. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
